intro: Parosela pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and fragrance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
